page.title: 06Ecology in Helford area
page.content: The St Martin,Manaccan,Helford area is open farmland,river and woodland.A well used network of footpaths connects farms villages and river. An unspoilt area. Widlife abounds_ Foxes, badgers, hares, rabbits and grey squirrels, hedgehogs, rats and mice are common.Some stoats weasels and mink.Most common insects, birds,fish. Vegetation includes ancient oak and beech woodland mentioned in Domesday book.Some trees 300 to 400 years old. Buzzards breed here regularly ; herons breed in Polwheveral creek. Sycamore , ash and ilyx are common.Some Cornish elms; English elms dying from Dutch elm disease. Climate is temperate maritime: SW prevailing wind.The river is sheltered Frost and snow rare.Sea mists common.No air and some river pollution from fertiliser.River silting up.
